LIRR President Hosts Customer Conversation Events

The LIRR will hold two "Customer Conversations" forums to gather ideas and insights from commuters, leisure travelers and community residents on ways to improve the LIRR customer experience. The first event will be held on May 31st at Adelphi University in Garden City. The second event will be held on Thursday, June 7th at Long Island MacArthur Airport Art Gallery in Ronkonkoma. LIRR President Hosts Customer Conversation Events

The LIRR will hold two "Customer Conversations" forums to gather ideas and insights from commuters, leisure travelers and community residents on ways to improve the LIRR customer experience. The first event will be held on May 31st at Adelphi University in Garden City. The second event will be held on Thursday, June 7th at Long Island MacArthur Airport Art Gallery in Ronkonkoma. Doors open at 6 PM. The event starts at 7 PM. Both events are accessible via the LIRR. There will also be plenty of free parking. For more information, click on attached link.

LIRR President Hosts Customer Conversation Events

The LIRR will hold two "Customer Conversations" forums to gather ideas and insights from commuters, leisure travelers and community residents on ways to improve the LIRR customer experience. The first event will be held on May 31st at Adelphi University in Garden City. The second event will be held on Thursday, June 7th at Long Island MacArthur Airport Art Gallery in Ronkonkoma. Doors open at 6 PM. The event starts at 7 PM. Both events are accessible via the LIRR. There will also be plenty of free parking. For more information, click on attached link.

UPDATED: Metro-North's Memorial Day Weekend Service (May 26-28)

To help you on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

New Haven Line - Cos Cob Bridge Opening
An opening of the Cos Cob Bridge, in the vicinity of Cos Cob, is scheduled for 6:00 AM today, May 26, 2018. This opening could cause delays. We will provide updates as needed.

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has early getaway service on Friday, May 25 from Hoboken and Penn Station-NY. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m. Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a weekend schedule. See our schedules page for train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtransit.com . Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has extra early getaway service on Friday, May 25 and plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Friday, May 25, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between roughly 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Some late p.m. peak trains will be canceled/combined. All extra and cancelled trains are shown in the current timetable. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

The 12:40PM train from Port Washington due Penn at 1:25PM is canceled today due to equipment trouble. Customers accommodated by the 1:10PM train from Port Washington due Penn at 1:55PM making all the same stops. We apologize for the inconvenience.

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has extra early getaway service on Friday, May 25 and plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Friday, May 25, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between roughly 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Some late p.m. peak trains will be canceled/combined. All extra and cancelled trains are shown in the current timetable. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has early getaway service on Friday, May 25 from Hoboken and Penn Station-NY. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m. Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a weekend schedule. See our schedules page for train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtransit.com . Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has early getaway service on Friday, May 25 from Hoboken and Penn Station-NY. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m. Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a weekend schedule. See our schedules page for train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtransit.com . Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has extra early getaway service on Friday, May 25 and plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Friday, May 25, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between roughly 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Some late p.m. peak trains will be canceled/combined. All extra and cancelled trains are shown in the current timetable. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has early getaway service on Friday, May 25 from Hoboken and Penn Station-NY. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m. Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a weekend schedule. See our schedules page for train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtransit.com . Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has extra early getaway service on Friday, May 25 and plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Friday, May 25, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between roughly 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Some late p.m. peak trains will be canceled/combined. All extra and cancelled trains are shown in the current timetable. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has extra early getaway service on Friday, May 25 and plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Friday, May 25, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between roughly 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Some late p.m. peak trains will be canceled/combined. All extra and cancelled trains are shown in the current timetable. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has early getaway service on Friday, May 25 from Hoboken and Penn Station-NY. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m. Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a weekend schedule. See our schedules page for train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtransit.com Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has early getaway service on Friday, May 25 from Hoboken and Penn Station-NY. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m. Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a weekend schedule. See our schedules page for train times at http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/planning/schedules/linkwest.html or visit www.njtransit.com Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

To help you get a jump on the Memorial Day weekend - the unofficial start of summer - Metro-North has extra early getaway service on Friday, May 25 and plenty of trains to take you to your holiday destinations. On Friday, May 25, there are 17 extra "getaway" departures from Grand Central Terminal between roughly 1 p.m. and 4 p.m. Some late p.m. peak trains will be canceled/combined. All extra and cancelled trains are shown in the current timetable. On Saturday, May 26 & Sunday, May 27, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, May 28, Memorial Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect on the Harlem, Hudson and New Haven Lines. For train times see our schedules page at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download our Train Time App! Most connecting services will not operate on Memorial Day. However, the Tappan Zee Express will operate on a Saturday schedule. Grand Central North will be closed Saturday, Sunday and Monday. Have a safe Memorial Day weekend!

Weekday Off-Peak Busing in Effect for Port Jervis Station customers, Wed., May 23 - Fri., May 25

For trains operating to Port Jervis: Busing will start with the 10:16 AM train from Middletown to Port Jervis, (train 43) and end after the 11:45 AM train (train 45) departing Middletown. For trains operating to Hoboken/Penn Station: Busing will start with the 11:30 AM train (train 62) to Hoboken/Penn Station, and end after the 1:39 PM train (train 64) from Port Jervis. This is necessary due to the development of a new track condition that requires immediate maintenance. Buses will follow train schedules. Thank you for your patience during this work to improve our right of way. For more information, please see this link, http://ow.ly/CLQh30k8byh

Weekday Off-Peak Busing in Effect for Port Jervis Station customers, Wed., May 23 - Fri., May 25

For trains operating to Port Jervis: Busing will start with the 10:16 AM train from Middletown to Port Jervis, (train 43) and end after the 11:45 AM train (train 45) departing Middletown. For trains operating to Hoboken/Penn Station: Busing will start with the 11:30 AM train (train 62) to Hoboken/Penn Station, and end after the 1:39 PM train (train 64) from Port Jervis. This is necessary due to the development of a new track condition that requires immediate maintenance. Buses will follow train schedules. Thank you for your patience during this work to improve our right of way. For more information, please see this link, http://ow.ly/CLQh30k8byh

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For specific scheduling information please visit our service update page http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/UpperHarlemSubstituteBusService.pdf Please also refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Saturday & Sunday, May 19-20

Substitute buses will operate between Waterbury and Bridgeport for all trains on Saturday, May 19 and select trains on Sunday, May 20, to accommodate Devon Bridge work. Regular train service will resume on Sunday evening with the 7:02 p.m. train departing GCT, the 8:42 p.m. departing Bridgeport and the 10:10 p.m. departing Waterbury. Bridgeport-bound buses will operate up to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. For full details and schedule, see https://goo.gl/CiydRq. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement work.
Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For specific scheduling information please visit our service update page http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/UpperHarlemSubstituteBusService.pdf Please also refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Subject: Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For specific scheduling information please visit our service update page http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/UpperHarlemSubstituteBusService.pdf Please also refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

BWB - COLLISION; QUEENS BOUND ONE ROADWAY IS BLOCKED. EXPECT DELAYS AND ALLOW FOR EXTRA TRAVEL TIME.
An Explanation for Last Evening's (Wed., May 16) Harlem Line Delays

The delays you experienced last evening were due in part to the continued after effects of Tuesday's severe weather. At approximately 5:30 PM, the height of the PM rush hour, a train struck a downed tree on our tracks in the vicinity of Crestwood. This took one of two tracks between Crestwood and Scarsdale out of service. Crews were immediately dispatched to remove the fallen tree. However, this incident was further complicated by the fact that there was damage to the third rail on the remaining track. As a result, trains could not operate through the area until the tree was removed at approximately 7PM. Trains were then able to operate on one track in the area but with the high volume of train traffic, delays quickly built from 20 to 90-plus minutes. Crews successfully completed track and third rail repairs at approximately 9:30 PM. We regret any inconvenience you may have experienced as a result of these delays.

Marine Parkway Bridge Closed Overnight Weekdays

Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge will be will be closed to traffic in both directions during the overnight hours between 11:30 p.m. and 5 a.m. on weekdays from Monday through Saturday morning for the next two weeks to perform necessary maintenance work on the bridge. There will be no closures on weekends. During the closure, all traffic will be detoured to the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge including the Q35 bus service. Motorist should allow extra travel time during these closures.

Marine Parkway Bridge Closed Overnight Weekdays

Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge will be will be closed to traffic in both directions during the overnight hours between 11:30 p.m. and 5 a.m. on weekdays from Monday through Saturday morning for the next two weeks to perform necessary maintenance work on the bridge. There will be no closures on weekends. During the closure, all traffic will be detoured to the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge including the Q35 bus service. Motorist should allow extra travel time during these closures.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For specific scheduling information please visit our service update page http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html Please also refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 19-20 and June 2-3, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For specific scheduling information please visit our service update page http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html Please also refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Video Cameras on Pascack Valley and Port Jervis Line to Improve Safety & Security for Customers & Employees

NJ TRANSIT has installed video cameras in customer areas of rail cars on Metro-North's the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. This includes the already completed outward and inward facing cameras on Metro-North's fleet of 15 Cab Cars and 15 locomotives. Outward-facing cameras will record track and wayside activities; inward-facing cameras will record the engineer's control area. NJ TRANSIT has also begun installation of cameras on Metro-North's 65 Comet V coaches. These passenger-area cameras will improve customer and crew safety, aid investigations after accidents and other incidents, and help deter behaviors that could affect safe train operations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/serviceupdates.htm?story=1172

This includes the already completed outward and inward facing cameras on Metro-North's fleet of 15 Cab Cars and 15 locomotives. Outward-facing cameras will record track and wayside activities; inward-facing cameras will record the engineer's control area. NJ TRANSIT has also begun installation of cameras on Metro-North's 65 Comet V coaches. These passenger-area cameras will improve customer and crew safety, aid investigations after accidents and other incidents, and help deter behaviors that could affect safe train operations. See full details at http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/serviceupdates.htm?story=1172

Marine Parkway-Gil Hodges Memorial Bridge will be will be closed to traffic in both directions during the overnight hours between 11:30 p.m. and 5 a.m. on weekdays from Monday through Saturday morning for the next two weeks to perform necessary maintenance work on the bridge. Motorist should allow extra travel time during these closures.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 5-6 & 19-20 and June 2-3 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 5-6, May 19-20 and June 2-3, substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs to multiple downed power poles and lines in the area. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. For specific scheduling information please visit our service update page http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html Please also refer to our interactive schedules at http://as0.mta.info/mnr/schedules/sched_form.cfm or download TrainTime for train/bus times. Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

May 4, 5 & 6: This Weekend's Service Changes Start Friday Night

Starting tomorrow night and continuing through Sunday, 5/6, plan for weekend schedule changes related to trackwork. Sat/Sun service between Penn Station & Huntington will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly and service between Huntington & Port Jefferson will be reduced from every 90 minutes to every two hours. There are changes to connecting service on other branches, plus some eastbound Friday night trains will depart Penn Station a few minutes earlier than usual. Pick up a special weekend timetable or see attached link:
May 5 & 6: Port Washington Br. Service Reduced to Hourly (Except during Mets Games)

This weekend, Port Washington Branch train service will be reduced from half-hourly to hourly while Positive Train Control testing is underway. To accommodate baseball fans, half-hourly service will be reinstated just before, during and after the Mets games on Saturday & Sunday. Service will continue to run half hourly until about 30 minutes after each game ends. For details, pick up the special Port Washington Branch weekend timetable, or visit attached link.
May 5 & 6: Weekend Service Reduced on Huntington/Port Jefferson Branch

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 5-6 & May 19-20 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 5-6 and May 19-20 substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. For full details on both schedules, please visit this page, http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.

Upper Harlem Substitute Bus Service, Saturdays & Sundays, May 5-6 & May 19-20 Includes Croton Falls, Purdy's, Southeast, Brewster, and Wassaic

For Saturdays and Sundays, May 5-6 and May 19-20 substitute bus service will be in effect between Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls, Purdy's, Goldens Bridge and Wassaic due to ongoing repairs in the area that occurred as a result of the March nor'easters. Wassaic Branch Customers: Trains will depart 10 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departure times at all stations between Wassaic and Patterson in order to connect with bus service at Southeast. Southeast, Brewster, Croton Falls and Purdy's Customers: All buses will depart about 20 minutes ahead of the regularly scheduled southbound train departures in order to connect with train service at Goldens Bridge. Harlem Line train service continues to operate between Grand Central Terminal and Goldens Bridge and between Southeast and Wassaic. For full details on both schedules, please visit this page, http://web.mta.info/supplemental/mnr/mnr_weather_info.html Customers can also use the Hudson Line, where tickets will be cross-honored. Please listen for station announcements. Thank you for your patience while we perform this critical repair work.
